alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Tuscaloosa; Walker (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 3:49PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Walker, north central Tuscaloosa and southeastern Fayette Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 349 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bankston, or 8 miles southeast of Fayette, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cordova, Berry, Parrish, Oakman, Bankston, Boley Springs, Gorgas Steam Plant, Gorgas, Stone Wall, Whitson, Goodsprings, West Corona, Fayette County Public Lake, New Lexington, Wiley, The Wye, Tutwiler and Corona. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for central and west central Alabama.
